titlestmt.author: Chinwendu “Rose” Ejezie; Julia Taylor

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Toni Beauchamp Papers 1985/2008

did.head: Overview of the Collection

repository.label: Repository:
repository.corpname: Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries

did.abstract: This collection is housed in 45 boxes and organized into 12 series entitled: Buffalo Bayou Partnership, Market Square Park Project, Art Lies (the magazine), good (the book), Blaffer Gallery, Friends of Integrative Medicine, Uncommon Cents, News clippings, photographs, A/V Materials, and Ephemera/Index Cards. Materials within this collection have been arranged topically and therein in chronological order.

bioghist.head: Biographical Information:
bioghist.p: Toni Beauchamp was born in Houston Texas on September 11, 1945 to Margaret Brown and Raymond Gin. Due to racial tensions and pressures placed on her parents, which resulted in their divorce, Toni was reared until school age by her nurturing maternal grandmother, Minnie Bell Caddell Brown. This experience fueled her desire to bridge the racial gap in later years. Toni's mother eventually married John Nobler, and Toni soon gained a half sister, Carolyn.

While attending Lamar High School in 1961, Toni met her future husband and soul mate Jeff, who was then a student at UT Austin. Toni and Jeff were married in 1963 and would spend the next 48 years together working alongside each other in various ventures. Toni played a major role to the success of their first company, Intermat, which they sold in 1997.

Toni’s love for the arts prompted her to pursue a career in Art History. As a result, she earned her BA from the University of Houston and her MA from The University of Texas at Austin. She firmly believed in the transformative power of public art, and her 1983 Master's thesis on James Johnson Sweeney and the Museum of Fine Arts, Houston was a groundbreaking work of art history scholarship. The thesis recounted the life of the renowned museum curator and director, not only as a biographical narrative but also as an exploration of the city's art institutions and the development of the local art world. This publication generated many of the concepts that Toni would explore in later publications.

Her deep passions for all things art and her immense contributions to the art and civic worlds enabled her to affect change through her endless hours of service on boards and advisory committees. Toni will forever be remembered and beloved for her ability to use the power of art to transform the surrounding community. After a courageous battle with ovarian cancer, she passed away on March 9, 2012. She is survived by her husband Jeffery O. Beauchamp, her mother Margaret Brown, and her father Raymond Tong Gin.

controlaccess.head: Access Terms
controlaccess.p: This Collection is indexed under the following controlled access subject terms.

accruals.head: Accruals:
accruals.p: Additional materials were acquired in 2014 as part of a donation by Jeff Beauchamp

userestrict.head: Conditions Governing Use:
userestrict.p: Special Collections owns the physical items in our collections, but copyright normally belongs to the creator of the materials or their heirs. The researcher has full responsibility for determining copyright status, locating copyright holders, and abiding by current copyright laws when publishing or displaying copies of Special Collections material in print or electronic form. For more information, consult the appropriate librarian.
Reproduction decisions will be made by Special Collections staff on a case-by-case basis. Patrons are responsible for obtaining permission to publish from copyright holders.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation:
prefercite.p: Toni Beauchamp Papers. Courtesy of Special Collections, University of Houston Libraries.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Information of acquisition method not available.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This collection is housed in 45 boxes and organized into 12 series entitled: Buffalo Bayou Partnership, Market Square Park Project, Art Lies (the magazine), good (the book), Blaffer Gallery, Friends of Integrative Medicine, Uncommon Cents, News clippings, photographs, A/V Materials, and Ephemera/Index Cards. Materials within this collection have been arranged topically and therein in chronological order.

did.unittitle: Master Planning Process, Buffalo Bayou Partnership

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents one of the major projects in which Toni Beauchamp was involved in a leadership role. It contains well-documented information that gives an account of the various roles and projects executed by Toni Beauchamp and others in developing the Buffalo Bayou Master Plan for Buffalo Bayou Park (BBP). It is further broken down into various subseries that detail history, correspondence, board of director, professional consultation/development, financials, networking/publicity, memoranda, projects, and other information as it relates to BBP.

did.unittitle: Pilot, Related Case Studies, and Research
Water Research Institute of Blue Hill Project
Blue Gold Global Water Crisis Project
Cultural Arts Council of Houston/Harris County (CACHH) affiliated with BBP
Market Square Park Project, A Project of DiverseWorks

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series, represnting another major project in which Toni Beauchamp was involved in a leadership role, contains detailed and documented information that gives an account of the various roles and works that Toni and others executed in relation to the Market Square Park Project (MSPP). The documents highlight the development and progression of the project. This series is further sub-divided into subseries that include history, projects, correspondence, financials, funding, board of directors, professional consultant, and printed materials related to MSPP.

did.unittitle: Park Donors and Copy of Text from Donor Column
Steering Committee Meeting Minutes and Agendas
A Guide to Houston Cultural Activities for the Young: Junior League of Houston Inc.
Public Relations Firm– Rivers Smith Baldwin Carlsberg
Board Update on Market Square Park
DiverseWorks Panel for the Last 30 Years

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series details another major project in this collection: Toni Beauchamp’s long-running affiliation with Art Lies magazine (now a part of Gulf Coast Magazine, a project of UH Creative Writing Program). The Series is further broken down into various subseries that deal with history, projects, correspondence, management, government relations, committees, financials, and articles, all in relation to Art Lies.

did.unittitle: Floppy Disc Containing Foundation Letters and Attachment
Cultural Arts Council of Houston Harris (CACHH)
Production and Distribution Masterpiece Litho Incorporated
Art Lies Distribution Notebook or Journal

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series represents the fourth major project detailed in this collection. It consists of various elements of good, the book that Toni edited and produced in recognition of the new century: her Millennium Project. She commissioned artist Mel Chin to produce a sculpture (subsequently gifted to MFA,H) and cover art, and local people from all walks of life to write their story of being in Houston; edited the resulting essays; and produced the book. The Series is further broken down into various subseries that deal with history, projects, correspondence, management, Government relations, committees, financials, and articles relating to good.

did.unittitle: A Proposed Legacy for the Millennium Project
Research Materials Used in Putting Together good

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series represents the fifth major project detailed in this collection. It consists of various projects and events with which Toni Beauchamp was affiliated in relation to Blaffer Gallery, University of Houston. This Series is further broken down into subseries that deal with projects, correspondence, management, and articles relating to the Blaffer.

did.unittitle: U of H Art Dept. / Michelle Taylor
Partners in Philanthropy, University of Houston School of Music
Friends of Integrative Medicine (FIM), The University of Texas MD Anderson Cancer Center.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents the sixth major project in this collection. Toni conceived, founded, and led FIM until her death in 2012, after which it continued as a project of UTMDACC. The Series consists of various projects and events with which Toni Beauchamp was affiliated in relation to Friends of Integrative Medicine. This Series is further broken down into subseries that deal with projects, correspondence, management, and articles relating to FIM.

did.unittitle: Spirituality and Healing in Medicine– The Harvard Medical School and the Mind / Body Etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series represents the seventh major project in this collection. It consists of various projects and events with which Toni Beauchamp was affiliated in relation to Uncommon Cents, an investment “club” that Toni co-conceived, co-founded, and led. This Series is further broken down into subseries that deal with projects, correspondence, management, and articles relating to Common Cents.

did.unittitle: Women of Achievement Investment Club– Treasurers Ref Book

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series documents various other projects Toni Beauchamp was affiliated with in Houston’s Art Community/Organizations and her other varied interests. This series is further broken down into subseries that are characterized by the names of these other groups, including Cultural Arts Council of Houston/ Harris County; Museum of Fine Arts, Houston; Contemporary Art Museum Houston, and Orange Show; as well as arts advocacy.

unittitle.emph: Conflict in the Arts: The Relocation of Authority

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of full newspapers and newspaper and magazine clippings that contain information regarding the various projects with which Toni Beauchamp was affiliated, as well as general subject matters that were of interest to her. Some of the topics that can be found in this series include Robert Wilson, arts and architecture, John Biggers, Market Square Park, and real estate, among others.

did.unittitle: Politics Relating to Art and General

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of photographs of various projects and events in which Toni Beauchamp was engaged. The pictures consist of projects such as; DiverseWorks, Market Square Park, and the Millennium Project, among others. Each project and event is separated into folders as listed below:

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consists of VCD’S, CD’s and Disk players that contains information relating to the various projects and events in which Toni Beauchamp was engaged. These projects include; Buffalo Bayou Park, DiverseWorks, Market Square Park, James Johnson Sweeney, Toni’s thesis research, and Friends of Integrative Medicine.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: This series consist of Ephemera such as awards given to Toni Beauchamp and Index cards that she used to take notes while carrying out various research for projects.
